rationale: The species is endemic to lower and middle Mekong where it is undergoing significant declines due to over harvesting. Its generation length is estimated to be about 6 years (lives up to 10 years). It is inferred that across the species entire range, the species has declined by more than 30% (but less than 50%) in the past 15-20 years. There is limited data on the species population, but this species is clearly in decline.
evaluator: Kottelat, M., Smith, K., Kullander, S.O., Ng, H.H. & Rainboth, W.
